annotation.spannedText: The fact is vaccines save lives and protect against the spread of disease

classMention.mentionClass: The fact is vaccines save lives and protect against the spread of disease

annotation.spannedText: If you decide not to immunize, you’re not only putting your child at risk to catch a disease that is dangerous or deadly but also putting others in contact with your child at risk

classMention.mentionClass: If you decide not to immunize, you’re not only putting your child at risk to catch a disease that is dangerous or deadly but also putting others in contact with your child at risk

annotation.spannedText: Getting vaccinated is much better than getting the disease

classMention.mentionClass: Getting vaccinated is much better than getting the disease

annotation.spannedText: some of the most devastating diseases that affect children have been greatly reduced or eradicated completely thanks to vaccination

classMention.mentionClass: some of the most devastating diseases that affect children have been greatly reduced or eradicated completely thanks to vaccination

annotation.spannedText: Today, we protect children and teens from 16 diseases that can have a terrible effect on their young victims if left unvaccinated

classMention.mentionClass: Today, we protect children and teens from 16 diseases that can have a terrible effect on their young victims if left unvaccinated

annotation.spannedText: you need to get all the scientific facts from a medical professional you can trust before making any decisions based on stories you may have seen or heard on TV, the Internet, or from other parents

classMention.mentionClass: you need to get all the scientific facts from a medical professional you can trust before making any decisions based on stories you may have seen or heard on TV, the Internet, or from other parents

annotation.spannedText: Vaccines work

classMention.mentionClass: Vaccines work

annotation.spannedText: They have kept children healthy and have saved millions of lives for more than 50 years

classMention.mentionClass: They have kept children healthy and have saved millions of lives for more than 50 years

annotation.spannedText: And if a vaccinated child does get the disease, the symptoms are usually less serious than in a child who hasn’t been vaccinated

classMention.mentionClass: And if a vaccinated child does get the disease, the symptoms are usually less serious than in a child who hasn’t been vaccinated

annotation.spannedText: There may be mild side effects, like swelling where the shot was given, but they do not last long

classMention.mentionClass: There may be mild side effects, like swelling where the shot was given, but they do not last long

annotation.spannedText: it is rare for side effects to be serious

classMention.mentionClass: it is rare for side effects to be serious

annotation.spannedText: Vaccines are safe

classMention.mentionClass: Vaccines are safe

annotation.spannedText: Vaccines are necessary

classMention.mentionClass: Vaccines are necessary

annotation.spannedText: your children should receive all recommended childhood vaccines

classMention.mentionClass: your children should receive all recommended childhood vaccines

annotation.spannedText: Your pediatrician

classMention.mentionClass: Your pediatrician

annotation.spannedText: it's important that your children are vaccinated

classMention.mentionClass: it's important that your children are vaccinated

annotation.spannedText: Vaccines are studied

classMention.mentionClass: Vaccines are studied

annotation.spannedText: All doctors must report certain side effects of vaccines to VAERS

classMention.mentionClass: All doctors must report certain side effects of vaccines to VAERS

annotation.spannedText: Just as important as the initial vaccinations are the booster shots

classMention.mentionClass: Just as important as the initial vaccinations are the booster shots

annotation.spannedText: Herd immunity is the benefit everyone receives from a vaccinated population once immunization reaches a critical level

classMention.mentionClass: Herd immunity is the benefit everyone receives from a vaccinated population once immunization reaches a critical level

annotation.spannedText: When enough people are vaccinated, everyone—including those who are too young or too sick to be immunized—receives some protection from the spread of diseases

classMention.mentionClass: When enough people are vaccinated, everyone—including those who are too young or too sick to be immunized—receives some protection from the spread of diseases

annotation.spannedText: relying on herd immunity to keep your child safe is risky

classMention.mentionClass: relying on herd immunity to keep your child safe is risky

annotation.spannedText: The more parents that follow this way of thinking, the fewer vaccinated children we will have, and the more likely a serious disease will return and infect all of those unvaccinated

classMention.mentionClass: The more parents that follow this way of thinking, the fewer vaccinated children we will have, and the more likely a serious disease will return and infect all of those unvaccinated

annotation.spannedText: The information contained on this Web site should not be used as a substitute for the medical care and advice of your pediatrician

classMention.mentionClass: The information contained on this Web site should not be used as a substitute for the medical care and advice of your pediatrician
